I hate this game, but in the kind of good way. It has many issues like most games but somehow always HOOKS you back in. Killers are fun to play and get the hang of. When you kill using a certain power your left feeling full and happy about it. If that's not your style then you can go on the survivor side. Your objective is to loop, sneak, and repair while either staying away for the killer, or trying to loop them. the community though is kinda toxic at times but hey, I'm sure you'll get used to it.

I have had a good for the most part. However, to really get into the fun parts of the game you're gonna have to put up with some terrible games and behavior from the other players. It will be frustrating, but if you like the idea of its cat and mouse gameplay, can get some friends to play with, and have the patience to learn the ins and outs this can be a great time.

Company worked in part with the creation of an NFT without being straightforward about doing so. 
I respect the creative team on this game but for the head of the company not so much at all.
I enjoy this game especially with friends, regardless of it's flaws that need to be fixed but I can't recommend this game for anyone to try out or get into. 
Save your money and buy a game with a company that cares about it's product and community. (and not cashing out.)
